text: Sir Thomas de Somerville of Linton and Carnwarth, (c.1245-1300) was a 13th-14th century Scottish noble. He was Baron of Linton. Thomas was the son of Sir William de Somerville.Burke, p.451 He swore fealty and homage to King Edward I of England on 15 May 1296 at Roxburgh. During 1297 he joined Sir William Wallace in rebellion.Douglas, p. 626 ==Family== Thomas had the following known issue: *Walter, who married Giles, daughter of Sir John Herring. *John, executed at Newcastle upon Tweed on 4 August 1306. ==Citations== ==References== *Burke, Bernard.
